title: [CMB] [$250] Don't show `New workspace` button when the restrict policy creation security group is enabled

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.2.22-6 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** None **Issue reported by:** @JmillsExpensify ## Action Performed: 1. Be a member on a private domain with the `enableRestrictedPolicyCreation` securityGroup setting enabled ([Ref](https://github.com/Expensify/App/blob/6823a5842be9cba32ffb2803912076f8e91a2b70/src/types/onyx/SecurityGroup.ts#L5-L7)) 2. Go to Workspaces tab 3. Observe the `New workspace` button 4. Click the `New workspace` button 5. Observe it error out. ## Expected Result: This domain securityGroup setting prevents users from creating workspace, so let's hide the button like we do on Classic. Note: Please make sure to also hide the "New workspace" button in the global create FAB as well. ## Actual Result: The button shows and creating a workspace errors out ## Workaround: Yes, disable the domain security group setting. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
Platforms Tested: On which of our officially supported platforms was this issue tested: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop
## Screenshots/Videos [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.28-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1221/folder/13176730/41237110/941908457 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdionjsdoisjdos@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause - Internal Team ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Log in with a new account 3. Create a workspace 4. Go to Inbox 5. Open FAB > Create report → The new report is created on Inbox 6. Create two more workspaces 7. Delete the default workspace 8. Go to Inbox 9. Open FAB > Create report 10. Select any workspace → The new report is created on Reports ## Expected Result: In Step 5 and 7, the new report should be created on the same tab ## Actual Result: In Step 5, when there is a default workspace, the new report is created on Inbox In Step 7, when there is no default workspace and there are at least two non-default workspaces, the new report is created on Reports ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop

title: Reports - After reset app, expense row does not show negative sign on Reports > Expenses

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel!
___

**Version Number:** 9.2.28-1
**Reproducible in staging?:** Yes
**Reproducible in production?:** N/A - new feature, doesn't exist in prod
**If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/65001
**Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** jsdoijnsondijodjnsoj@gmail.com
**Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team
**Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome
**App Component:** Search

## Action Performed:
1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com
2. Go to workspace chat.
3. Create an expense with negative amount in workspace chat.
4. Go to Account > Troubleshoot > Clear cache and restart > Reset and refresh.
5. Go to Reports > Expenses.

## Expected Result:
After reset app, expense row will show the negative amount on Reports > Expenses.

## Actual Result:
After reset app, expense row does not show the negative amount on Reports > Expenses. It appears as positive amount.

## Workaround:
Unknown

## Platforms:
- [x] Android: App
- [x] Android: mWeb Chrome
- [x] iOS: App
- [x] iOS: mWeb Safari
- [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome
- [x] Windows: Chrome
- [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari
- [x] MacOS: Desktop

labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.28-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/69875 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sddsojsdnsij@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace chat. 3. Create an expense with receipt in the workspace chat. 4. Create another expense with the same amount but without receipt. 5. Open the expense report. 6. Click Review duplicates. 7. Click Keep this one on the expense without receipt. 8. Select the details if prompted. 9. Reach confirm page. ## Expected Result: On confirm page, empty receipt modal will be shown. ## Actual Result: On confirm page, empty receipt modal is missing. This issue happens when one expense has receipt and the other expense does not have receipt. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1faae69e-93c1-4e40-b829-3f625a0a26c8 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.28-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-1221/folder/18717689/49855697/941909022 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sjodinsoijsoisjo@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: - Account has self DM. 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to self DM. 3. Click + > Track distance > Manual. 4. Enter amount > Next. 5. On confirm page, click Rate. 6. Click Upgrade > Got it, thanks. 7. Enter a rate and click Save. 8. On confirm page, click RHP back button. 9. Click RHP back button. ## Expected Result: RHP should close. ## Actual Result: RHP reopens Add rate page. Then, back button reopens confirm page which reopens amount page again. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [x] iOS: mWeb Safari - [x] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/e48e68e4-ed3e-4411-82ba-5d8dce3683c7 [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)
